emuInput.TitMainTitle: Group portrait of seven women kneeling at altar rail, for National Prayer Day honoring Montgomery Alabama bus boycotters, in St. James AME Church
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 31, 1956, pg. 1, reads: "Thousands Observe 'Prayer Day' Here! - In Humble Supplication - As part of nation-wide observance of 'Prayer Day,' March 28, as advocated by Congressman Adam Clayton Powell, members of St. James AME Church gathered to send their prayer petitions up to cleanse racial bias from America's soul and to help the persecuted Montgomery, Ala. bus boycotters endure their ordeal until victory is finally won. - Harris Photo."
